meanings.definition: The act of moving something away from a place.
meanings.sent1: The removal of the old furniture was tiring.
meanings.sent2: The removal of the trash from the park was necessary.
meanings.sent3: The removal of the noisy alarm clock was a relief.
meanings.sent4: The removal of obstacles cleared the path to success.
meanings.sent5: The removal of the heavy burden lifted his spirits.

meanings.definition: The act of taking something or someone away from a place.
meanings.sent1: The removal of the lost child from the store was quick.
meanings.sent2: The removal of the painting from the wall revealed a hidden safe.
meanings.sent3: The removal of the mischievous cat from the room caused chaos.
meanings.sent4: The removal of doubts from his mind brought clarity.
meanings.sent5: The removal of the crown from the king symbolized his defeat.

meanings.definition: The process of eliminating or getting rid of something.
meanings.sent1: The removal of stains from the carpet required strong cleaner.
meanings.sent2: The removal of weeds from the garden improved its appearance.
meanings.sent3: The removal of the last slice of cake caused disappointment.
meanings.sent4: The removal of toxic thoughts from her mind brought peace.
meanings.sent5: The removal of barriers allowed for progress.
